intro: Spermacoce papuana, commonly known as the papuan horsegram, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific, including parts of Papua New Guinea. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Spermacoce papuana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. It has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties.
